generif.text: Pc2 dramatically enhances CtBP sumoylation. Pc2 is a SUMO E3, and Polycomb Group bodies may be sumoylation centers.
polycomb group (PcG) protein HPC2, which functions as a transcriptional suppressor, is a candidate of KyoT2-binding proteins
SIP1 sumoylation by Pc2 attenuates transcriptional repression of E-cadherin
Pc2 binds to and colocalizes with homeodomain interacting protein kinase 2 (HIPK2) and serves as a SUMO E3 ligase for this kinase.

The Endoplasmic reticulum-associated degradation (ERAD) machinery may thus be important for autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease pathogenesis because the regulation of PC2 expression by the ERAD pathway is altered by mutations in PC2.

Results show that DNA methyltransferase 3B enhances polycomb protein 2-mediated transcriptional repression of FGFR3, and suggest that DNMT3B is a co-repressor of hPc2 in inducing transcriptional repression independent of DNA methylation.
A phage display screen using the N-terminus of JARID1B as bait identified one of the JARID1B interacting proteins, namely PcG protein (Polycomb group) hPc2.
Huntingtin is a novel stimulator of polycomb repressive complex 2.
the hPc2-induced SUMOylation of alpha-synuclein could function as a cytoprotector by increasing alpha-synuclein aggregate formation within fibroblast cells.

14-3-3 protein binding to chromobox homolog 4 (CBX4) appears to modulate the interaction between CBX4 and the BMI1/PCGF components of polycomb recessive complex 1, but has no effect on CBX4-RING1/RNF2 interaction
Data show that PRC2 can integrate information provided by pre-existing histone modifications to accurately tune its enzymatic activity within a particular chromatin context.
plays role in regulation of epidermal stem cell proliferation and senescence
High Polycomb repressive complex protein is associated with mesothelioma.

Pc2, methylation controls the protein's interaction with two distinct ncRNAs, TUG1 and NEAT2, which results in the exclusive subnuclear localization of methylated and unmethylated Pc2 in Polycomb bodies and interchromatin granules, respectively.
ASXL1 associates with the PRC2 and loss of ASXL1 in vivo collaborates with NRASG12D to promote myeloid leukemogenesis.
High cytoplasmic expression of CBX4 is associated with hepatocellular carcinoma.
our findings demonstrate that Cbx4 plays a critical role in tumor angiogenesis by governing HIF-1alpha protein
The presence of CBX4-GFP in the same focus had a minor impact on BMI1 and RING1 recovery kinetics.

Role of Cbx4 in migration and metastasis of a metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma cell line. Results show that Cbx4 overexpression increases the in vitro vessel formation of vascular endothelial cells in its SUMO interaction motifs-dependent manner.
Cbx4 is an independent prognostic factor for HCC patients, and the patients with high Cbx4 expression should receive postoperative TACE treatment to improve their survival
provide evidence to show that CBX4 may serve as a tumor suppressor in colorectal carcinoma by recruiting HDAC3 to the Runx2 promoter to impede Runx2 expression
Data show that SUMO E3 ligase CBX4 sumoylates subpopulation of CtIP to regulate recruitment to breaks and resection.
Data show that USP26 interacts with PRC1 components chromobox (CBX)-containing proteins CBX4 and CBX6.

Data suggest that CBX4 expression is up-regulated in breast cancer and is correlated with unfavorable overall survival; CBX4 promotes cell growth and migration via transcriptionally suppressing expression of miR137 to trigger Notch1 signaling pathway. (CBX4 = chromobox homolog 4; miR137 = microRNA 137; Notch1 = neurogenic locus notch homolog protein-1)
Results identify a modifying enzyme for Prdm16, and they demonstrate a central role of Cbx4 in the control of Prdm16 stability and white fat browning.

CBX4 is up-regulated in breast cancer tissues and while its over-expression promotes cell proliferation, its knockdown suppresses cell proliferation in breast cancer cells. Furthermore, CBX4 mediates miR-129-5p-induced inhibition of cell proliferation and negatively correlates with the expression of miR-129-5p expression.
role of CBX4 in maintaining cellular homeostasis in mesenchymal stem cells
findings suggest that CBX4 rs2289728 and CBX7 rs139394 are protective SNPs against HCC. The two SNPs may reduce the risk of HCC while suppressing the expression of CBX4 and CBX7.
This is the evidence supporting the interaction between GRM4 and CBX4, which could inhibit the malignant behavior of osteosarcoma cells through the GRM4/CBX4/HIF-1alpha signaling pathway
CBX4 promotes the proliferation and metastasis via regulating BMI-1 in lung cancer.

Chromobox homolog 4 (CBX4) is overexpressed in osteosarcoma cell lines and tissues. CBX4 promotes metastasis by transcriptionally up-regulating Runx2 via the recruitment of GCN5 to the Runx2 promoter. The phosphorylation of CBX4 at T437 by casein kinase 1alpha (CK1alpha) facilitates its ubiquitination at both K178 and K280 and subsequent degradation by CHIP, and this phosphorylation of CBX4 could be reduced by TNFalpha.
Circular RNA hsa_circ_0008039 promotes proliferation, migration and invasion of breast cancer cells through upregulating CBX4 via sponging miR-515-5p.
SUMO E3 ligase CBX4 regulates hTERT-mediated transcription of CDH1 and promotes breast cancer cell migration and invasion.
Chromobox 4 facilitates tumorigenesis of lung adenocarcinoma through the Wnt/beta-catenin pathway.
Long intergenic noncoding RNA00265 promotes proliferation of gastric cancer via the microRNA-144-3p/Chromobox 4 axis.
The predictive potential of genetic single nucleotide polymorphisms in CBX4 for hepatocellular carcinoma survival.
CBX4-dependent regulation of HDAC3 nuclear translocation reduces Bmp2-induced osteoblastic differentiation and calcification in adamantinomatous craniopharyngioma.
CBX4 Regulates Replicative Senescence of WI-38 Fibroblasts.
CBX4 Regulates Long-Form Thymic Stromal Lymphopoietin-mediated Airway Inflammation through SUMOylation in House Dust Mite-induced Asthma.
MiR-507 inhibits the progression of gastric carcinoma via targeting CBX4-mediated activation of Wnt/beta-catenin and HIF-1alpha pathways.
Chromobox homolog 4 overexpression inhibits TNF-alpha-induced matrix catabolism and senescence by suppressing activation of the NF-kappaB signaling pathway in nucleus pulposus cells.
Long Noncoding RNA SNHG5 Induces the NF-kappaB Pathway by Regulating miR-181c-5p/CBX4 Axis to Promote the Progression of Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer.
MicroRNA-6838-5p suppresses the self-renewal and metastasis of human liver cancer stem cells through downregulating CBX4 expression and inactivating ERK signaling.
METTL3 Promotes Osteosarcoma Metastasis via an m6A-dependent Epigenetic Activity of CBX4.

BP.term: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

name: chromobox 4

biocarta.name: the prc2 complex sets long-term gene silencing through modification of histone tails

reactome.name: SUMOylation of DNA damage response and repair proteins
SUMO E3 ligases SUMOylate target proteins
SUMO E3 ligases SUMOylate target proteins
RUNX1 interacts with co-factors whose precise effect on RUNX1 targets is not known

summary: Enables SUMO binding activity; SUMO ligase activity; and enzyme binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nuclear body. Part of PRC1 complex. Implicated in hepatocellular carcinoma. Biomarker of hepatocellular carcinoma. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
